results.title: Knife in the water = Noz w wodzie. Repulsion. Cul-de-sac [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Zespol Camera, Compton, Stanislaw Zylewicz, Gene Gatowski and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski is a true auteur. Themes of ambiguity, sexual tension, insanity, and everyday tragedy make his surrealistic work inspirational and at the same time controversial. This three disc set presents three of his 1960’s features. “Knife in the water” is Polanski’s first feature. A married couple pick up a hitch hiker. Feelings of claustrophobia and sexual tension result as they are confined on a holiday in a small yacht. A jealous husband turns hostile. In Polish with English subtitles. “Repulsion” a psychological thriller focuses on the illusions and fantasies of a sexually repressed young woman (Catherine Deneuve). Being both repulsed and attracted by sex she has nightmares and horrific visions when alone for several days in her apartment. “Cul-de-sac” a black comedy where a strangely matched couple have their home invaded by two criminals. Life is disrupted by the eccentric and interesting gangsters. Tense and surreal. Cast include Donald Pleasance and Lionel Standing. Titles available on VHS. Title numbers 304192; 315657; 302532.

results.title: Klute
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Alan Pakula
results.brief_description: Her name is Bree Daniels. She’s a tough, high-priced call girl picking her way through the tangled lives that touch hers in the dark maze of New York. Bree once crossed paths with a vicious psychotic killer, who is now stalking her. The only person that can save her is Detective John Klute. Stars Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland. Excellent adult thriller with attention to detail and emphasis on character.

results.title: Klee Wyck (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Graham McInnes, ONF | NFB and Grant Crabtree
results.brief_description: The story of painter Emily Carr, ‘Klee Wyck’ or ‘Laughing One’ to her Indian friends. This famous Canadian artist has found inspiration for her work in British Columbia’s Pacific coast, its forest of giant trees and its Indian villages with their totems and carvings. Her canvases are shown with the scenes where they were painted. Editing, Cecily Sparks. Music, Maurice Blackburn.

results.title: Kiwis
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Ernie Leonard, a Maori who had relinquished his traditions and heritage became chief of his tribe at the age of 55. He had been a television compere, later becoming a television producer and Ernie was able to show how he had learnt language and traditions and helped in fostering this knowledge in the young. He now produces a television program in Maori each week called ‘Koha’.

results.title: Kitty Spit
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Kate Van Egmond
results.brief_description: Cat, Violet and Melody are Kitty Spit, a 3-piece band ready for good times and rock ‘n roll. However, Violet has broken up with her boyfriend and seems inconsolable. Cat and Melody do all they can to cheer her up, but will she ever be happy again? Girls, guitars and heartache - it’s what keeps them together.

results.title: Kitty and the cartwheelers' shopping jeep bonanza [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pia Abrahams, Teetotum Pictures, Film Victoria. Independent Film-makers' Fund and Michaela French
results.brief_description: This clever ‘mockumentry’ profiles a large range of shoppers and their affectionate relationship with that all-Australian icon: the shopping jeep. Using the South Melbourne market and Station Pier as a background, director Michaela French reveals the many faces of this Australian icon, from traditional brown vinyl to fully customable vehicle able to accommodate every usage and need, including pet limousine. Features an interview with a jeep manufacturer who enlightens the viewer as to the options available on the market, as well as interviews with jeep owners who describe how they have personalised the handy carrier.

results.title: Kitty and the bagman
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Forest Home Films and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: A drama about two of Sydney’s best known crime queens - Kitty O’Rourke and Big Lil - who created havoc in the underworld of the 1920’s. Together these two women ran the sly grog shops, gambling houses, prostitution and hold up merchants during the seamier side of 1920’s life in Australia. Stars Liddy Clark and John Stanton.

results.title: Kittens grow up
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: Studies the development of kittens from immediately after birth, through learning to walk, until they gain the ability to co-ordinate all their activities. Also covers the role of the mother cat in this development. Sequal to ‘Kittens are born’. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Kittens are born
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: Follows a female cat from pregnancy through labour and the birth of three kittens. Emphasises the birth process and parental care immediately following birth. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Kites: a collage of kites and kite flyers
results.creator_credit: Compass Films (UK), Arts Council of Great Britain, Peter R. Jones and Simon Heaven
results.brief_description: Shows kites soaring above city heights, wafting across scenic countryside and displaying an array of designs, shapes and multi-tiered constructions. Explores kite mechanics, traditional patterns and characteristics and scientific and other practical applications of these fanciful toys. Includes live footage of kite experiments and archival stills of similarly innovative attempts of the past.
